cause.description:
It's hard to believe, but there are still people in the US living in poverty without access to running water, quality healthcare, or a lot of the services you and I take for granted.
Running Strong works to solve problems of poverty, economic and social discrimination, inadequate health care, and disappearing cultural resources in Indian Country.
We support organic gardens, drill water wells, language classes, housing initiatives, and youth centers in over 15 states.
COME JOIN OUR CAUSE AND RUN STRONG WITH US
There are several ways you can get involved and make a difference:
1) Email info@indianyouth.org to join our online community and get updates on our work in the field.
2) Join our charity marathon team, TEAM RUNNING STRONG, and run a marathon to fundraise for our cause and raise awareness about the conditions in Indian Country. Visit http://www.indianyouth.org/join-team-rs.html or email marathon@indianyouth.org.
3) Post in articles, links, comments, or photos you have in this group!
1. All American Indians should have their immediate survival needs – food, water, and shelter – met.
2. It is important to promote self-sufficiency and economic growth among Native American youth.
3. It is important to promote self-esteem among Native American youth and to preserve disappearing cultural resources.
cause.mission: help American Indian people meet their immediate survival needs and build the capacity of Indian communities and grassroots Native organizations
cause.name: Running Strong for American Indian Youth®
